results.title: The Colonel comes to Japan
results.brief_description: Provides a fascinating look at the highly successful marketing of the Kentucky Fried Chicken product in Japan, noting the modifications to the standard American approach adopted to suit the Japanese business philosophy and life style. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.
results.description: Provides a fascinating look at the highly successful marketing of the Kentucky Fried Chicken product in Japan, noting the modifications to the standard American approach adopted to suit the Japanese business philosophy and life style. results.title: The Colonel
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Jenifer Hooks and AFTRS
results.brief_description: An army colonel, having outlived his usefulness to the revolution, is imprisoned. Refusing to sign a false confession, he is eventually forced into a position of choice - his principles or his life.

results.title: The Colombo Plan
results.creator_credit: Joy Batchelor and Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films
results.brief_description: A cartoon film on the Colombo Plan which links a number of countries throughout the world pledged to improve each other’s economic conditions. To increase prosperity and make the earth fruitful, technical knowledge and experience, equipment and funds, are essential before progress can be made. This cartoon shows how, in the past ten years, the people of Colombo Plan countries are benefitting from co-operation.

results.title: The Cold war
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History 1917-1967”.
Describes the origin and development of the hostility between the United States and USSR after 1945, the formation of the system of anti-communist alliances around the world and the respective spheres of influence. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Cold dawn
results.creator_credit: John Elliot, Air Ministry and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “War in the Air”.
Part 12 of a 15-part series telling the story of air power and its impact on the world specially compiled by the BBC in 1954-55, 90% of which comes from actual combat material. The remainder consists of extracts from war documentary films and sequences constructed and shot by BBC Production Unit with the co-operation and advice of the services. This part centres on the Winter and Spring of 1944-45 when the ring around Germany begins to tighten.

results.title: The Codling moth
results.creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the life cycle of the Codling Moth: the laying and hatching of the eggs; the larva burrowing to the centre of an apple and feeding; larva leaving the infected fruit for hibernation; spinning of the cocoon; changes taking place in the pupal stage; emergence of the adult moth. A diagrammatic section summarises the main stages of the life cycle. No narration, only music.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit

A diagrammatic section summarises the main stages of the life cycle. No narration, only music.

results.title: The Coconut tree
results.creator_credit: Hermann Schlenker and International Film Foundation
results.brief_description: Examines aspects of life in the Pacific Islands. The coconut is the islands’ only export and the coconut palm is also esential for the people’s immediate livelihood. Shows the products derived from this source by the islanders. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: The Coasts of Clyde
results.creator_credit: James Ritchie, Stewart McAllister and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A tour of the Firth of Clyde by Bernard Braden, Canadian film and stage actor. Visits to Largs and Dunoon, Rothesay and Loch Lomond; scientists working at a Fishing Research Station, holiday-makers on steamer trips up and down the firth; seals playing around the Kyles of Bute. Finally Braden visits Arran, the island where his grandparents left to sail for the new world.

results.title: The Coastguard
results.creator_credit: Simon Campbell-Jones, Michael Barden and R.H.R. Productions
results.brief_description: The film was made for the 150th anniversary of the founding of H.M. Coastguard. It shows the work carried out by the Coastguard Service in saving life at sea and on the coast, both directly and through their co-ordination with R.A.F. Navy, Post Office and R.N.L.I.

results.title: The Coasters
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Small coastal shipping in New Zealand, showing life on a coaster, loading, ports, storm at sea, dramatic incidents. The commentary is in rythmical verse.
